Employing more than 8,000 people, it is actively involved in education and research, management and administration, as well as technical and social service provision on a daily basis. It is one of the largest, most exciting employers in the area and offers great career opportunities. With its 11 faculties and more than 80 departments offering state-of-the-art study programs grounded in research in a wide range of academic fields, Ghent University is a logical choice for its staff and students. Moreover, the highly attractive city of Ghent is located at the heart of Europe and unfolds as a cultural and historical hub with a vibrant student lifestyle. The research team of Prof. Koen Raemdonck (Full Professor) is embedded in the Ghent Research Group on Nanomedicines at the laboratory for General Biochemistry and Physical Pharmacy, Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences of Ghent University. The group is a world-leading research lab on macromolecular drug delivery by nanomedicines. The lab hosts 5 professors and their multidisciplinary research teams, with on average 40 researchers with diverging scientific background, who collaborate closely on a daily basis. YOUR TASKS Currently, the exceptional therapeutic potential of RNA is not yet available for treatment of (chronic) respiratory pathologies due to a lack of enabling technologies. The team of Prof. Raemdonck is seeking a highly motivated and skillful postdoctoral researcher to work on ground-breaking RNA delivery technologies for inhalation therapy and beyond.The postdoc will assist in the development, optimization and (in vitro/in vivo) application of bio-inspired nanocarriers for RNA therapeutics. The project is of translational nature, aiming to merge fundamental insights with rational formulation design, and is expected to lead to high impact publications.The candidate shall also be committed to contribute to the supervision of (PhD) students, academic (grant) writing and support of general (scientific) lab activities.At least 70% of the assignment will be spent on academic research. WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR The position is open to motivated candidates with a strong background in nucleic acid therapeutics, biomaterials/nanomedicines and/or inhalation therapy and with a keen interest in both cell/chemical/molecular biology and biomedical applications.Eligible candidates must hold a thesis-based doctorate in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biomedical Sciences, Biomedical Engineering, Biochemistry/Biotechnology or equivalent (obtained max. 6 years ago; this term of 6 years is determined by the date written on the above-mentioned required diploma).Candidates are recommended to have a strong publication record and proven record in team work and/or (international) collaboration.Experience with animal models of (lung) pathologies is an asset.The applicant must be able to communicate fluently in English and demonstrate excellent academic writing and presentation skills. WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU This postdoctoral research project is fully funded by a European Union H2020 ERC Consolidator Grant (RESPIRNA), awarded to Prof. Raemdonck. We offer you a postdoctoral staff member contract of indefinite duration, with a minimum term of 1 year and a maximum term of 6 years. In case of a positive evaluation 1 year after the start, the contract can be extended.In case your application meets the hereto required conditions, it may be considered to recruit via a postdoctoral scholarship instead, with a maximum term of 3 years.Your contract will start in April 2022 or as soon as possible afterwards.You will be part of a dynamic, pluralistic and multidisciplinary team that is highly motivated to perform high-level research on drug delivery.
